article.title: 12 Best Things To Do In Cap-d'Agde, France
article.lead_paragraph: Cap d'Agde is a seaside town in Agde, France set on the Mediterranean sea. Prior to 1960 when Cap d'Agde started becoming a tourist destination for visitors in France, it was mainly a city that locals visited for a weekend getaway. With the development of the city as a tourist resort, more international visitors have started flocking to this beautiful port city.  Below are 12 varied things visitors to Cap d'Agde can engage in whilst in the city.
article.proposal:
Get Away To Cap-d'Agde, France
1. Head Outdoors To Plage de la Grande Conque. Rated very highly in Cap-d'Agde, France, this beach is a unique black sand beach sitting on the Mediterranean coast.  One will be able to spot a cove which has been carved out by the sea into the volcanic rock, therefore making it a volcanic beach.  It is a beautiful beach, both when the weather is comfortable and wild. 

2. Archaeology museum, Musée de l’Éphèbe.  This underwater archaeology museum which opened in 1987 overlooks the beautiful harbour of Cap d’Agde and contain several modern galleries. This museum contains exhibits collection of items recovered from the seabed, arising from shipwrecks. A visit to the museum will illustrate how cultures formed in Cap-d'Agde and trading conducted. The name of the museum arises from one artifact, the l’Éphèbe d’Agde, which is a late-Hellenistic bronze statue, assumed to be that of Alexander the Great.

3. Enjoy Luna Park As A Family. Luna Park or the Île des Loisirs  is situated in the centre of Cap d’Agde’s Luno Lagoon. It is an all age entertainment park catered to different types of recreation. The park includes several bars, restaurants and even a casino.  Luna park is essentially a funfair where entry is free and there are several rides for kids. If you have kids, head down to the park in the early evening so that they can enjoy riding on the carousels, jump around on the bouncy castles and slides. 

4. Amazing Experience At Cap d’Agde Naturist Village. Although not exactly a village in the actual sense, the Naturist Village is largely located by the sea. It is a vast fenced-off area and is easily accessible from the beach. The Naturist village is a self-contained town and has about 2,500 campsites, apartment complexes, hotel, several restaurants and so on. It is easy to spend the entire day at this resort. 

5. Spend A Day Whale Watching. Sail out into sea with  Terre Marine, a reputed tour company which organises trips out to sea. The office is located next to the information counter and reservations can be made at the office itself. While you enjoy your trip out at sea, you will also be able to enjoy the sight of whales and dolphins enjoying off the French coast. 

6. Visit A World Heritage Site. Take some time out to visit The Canal du Midi, which is a World Heritage Site. Get aboard a floating barge or stroll along the banks and enjoy the views of the canal. The 360km waterway links the Mediterranean with the Atlantic ocean featuring 328 structures. This remains one of the best engineering feats of the 17th century. 

7. Sip Wine At Hérault-Méditerranée. Cap d'Agde is known for its wine. Wine growing is indeed prevalent through the region. However, the best vineyard to perhaps enjoy the best of the region's wine would be the local villages of Hérault-Méditerranée. In fact, tourists to the region in the month of May can perhaps experience Vinocap, the largest open-air wine tourism exhibition held in South France. This exhibition is usually held Cap d'Agde's quayside on  the Ascension weekend, typically in the beginning of May.
article.meta_description: This seaside resort deserves mention as one of the most beautiful coastal towns in France that one can visit. With so many varied activities, Cap-d'Agde will keep everyone spellbound.

The Plage de la Grande Conque is one of the most beautiful sites in Cap d'Agde. The stunning site might seem like the least attractive of all attractions but it is truly beautiful. The Grande Conque is a volcanic beach with fine, black sand and fine pebbles. Surrounding the beach are cliffs which break off into two sets of stacks known as Les Deux Frères, otherwise known as two brothers. When the weather is in your favor, this is a perfect beach to frolic around in. Even if the weather is wild, you can stand atop the cliffs and watch the waves crash against the base of the cliffs with great force.

snippets.title: 3. Aquarium Marin du Cap d'Agde
snippets.description:
https://www.facebook.com/115057275197796/photos/a.352807131422808/1344647435572101/?type=3&theater

The aquarium in Cap d'Agde is completely natural and relies only on sea water for its water supply to sustain marine creatures. This aquarium has been renewed and serves a good attraction for everyone, especially young kids. The aquarium is built around three themes and the indoor attraction takes slightly over an hour. Presenting the Mediterranean fauna such as murres and seahorses, the aquarium is also home to tropical creatures such as turtles, corals, and sharks. Constructed very closely to the natural habitats of this marine life, the presentation of all these exhibits are of high quality. 

> #### Aquarium Marin du Cap d'Agde
>
> **Address**:  11 Rue des 2 Frères, 34300 Cap d'Agde, France
>
> **Website**: [Aquarium Marin du Cap d'Agde (in French)](http://www.aquarium-agde.com/accueil.html)

snippets.title: 5. Archaeology museum
snippets.description:
https://www.instagram.com/p/5sIWE0u-vh/?taken-at=311906852

Musée de l’Éphèbe is an underwater archaeology museum which overlooks the beautiful harbor in Cap d'Agde. This museum was opened in 1987 and consists of 3 galleries; modern gallery, bronze gallery, and antique gallery. The modern gallery contains exhibits like medieval ceramics, ammunition from the royal fleet and shipwrecked cargoes dating back to the 17th century. The antique gallery consists of items from maritime trade as well as ancient boats. The bronze gallery is especially impressive as it houses ancient bronzes. The museum derives its name from one exclusive item in the museum, the l’Éphèbe d’Agde, which is a late-Hellenistic bronze statue of a young man, purported to be Alexander the Great.

> #### Musée de l’Éphèbe
>
> **Address**:  34300 Agde, France
>
> **Website**: [Musée de l’Éphèbe (in French)](https://www.museecapdagde.com/)

snippets.description:

Why not try out something different for a change and set out on a boat. Whale watching is a popular activity in Cap d'Agde and the Mediterranean sea provides just the right opportunity to do so. There are dedicated whale watching companies which offer boat trips out to catch whales having a good time in the water apart from other tours like fishing and sunset tours. The boatmen will explain the various species of whales and also educate people on the various measures in place to protect these creatures and their habitats.

Do note that sightings are not always guaranteed. Nonetheless, you will still get a fun day out at sea with a fresh breeze blowing at your face. One reputed company which offers excellent trips out with top-notch service is Terre Marine. Do check out this company which offers such trips that are reasonably priced and reliable.

>
> **Address**:  Port du Cap d'agde - Quai Beaupre, 34300 Cap d'Agde, Agde, France
>
> **Website**: [Terre Marine (in French)](terre-marine.org/)

snippets.title: 9.  Visit a World Heritage Site
snippets.description:
Canal du Midi is a 240-kilometer (150-mile) long waterway which stretches from Toulouse to Sète and was constructed in the 17th century. It is one of its kind in the world and has been recognized as a UNESCO World Heritage site. Adge lies towards the end of the Canal du Midi just before ending at Sete. As such, this site can be visited while at Cap d'Agde. The canal is mainly used as a transportation route for irrigation as well as tourism. Visitors can take a boat ride along the canal and enjoy the sights and sounds of the city from this world heritage site.

What is unique about this canal at Agde is that the Agde lock is the sole round lock on the canal. This has been made out of volcanic rock and extends over three varying depths. This feature allows boats to navigate in different directions, heading further to Béziers towards Toulouse, Thau lagoon and the town of Agde. 
> ####  The Canal du Midi
>
> **Address**:  6 Rue Chassefière, 34300 Agde
>
> **Website**: [The Canal du Midi (in French)](http://www.bateaux-du-soleil.fr/excursion-canal-du-midi.asp)

snippets.title: 10.  Sip wine at Hérault-Méditerranée
snippets.description:
The Hérault Méditerranée region where Cap d'Agde lies on a perfect terrain for wine-growing. Cultivators have used this opportunity and converted the region into a wine tourism destination. Wine tourism maps can be found at the tourism office in Cap d'Agde, helping you plan your vineyard tours. The wines in Agde are highly reputable and provide an explosion of tastes.

In particular, Cap d’Agde welcomes Vinocap, an annual open-air wine tourism event. This event features several wine producers and exhibitors from Hérault Méditerranée and Languedoc-Roussillon. If you are in the city when Vinocap is held, then you are in for the time of your life with the opportunity to savor different wines from the region.
> #### Vinocap
>
> **Address**:  Cap d'Agde Quaside
>
> **Website**: [Vinocap](http://www.en.capdagde.com/webzine/gastronomy/a-unique-terroir-wines-character)

snippets.title: 11. Learn to kite surf
snippets.description:
Set along River Hérault, VentilEau is a popular kiteboarding destination in France, where you can take up private kite surfing classes, in groups of two and four. Enjoy a complimentary breakfast, before heading out to the sugar-white beaches of Vias Plage or the sandy shallows of Etang de Thau. Under the unfortunate circumstances of weak wind conditions, guests could participate in a range of activities such as wakeboarding, paddle boarding, or canoeing at Lake Salagou. Other non-water related available include hiking, mountain biking and beach bumming until sundown.


> #### Learn to kite surf 
>

snippets.title: 12. Take a class in paddle boarding
snippets.title_with_numbering: 12. Take a class in paddle boarding
snippets.description:
Clad in wetsuits, groups of paddle boarders are seen standing on what looks like an oversized surfboard and propelling themselves along the coast of Palavas-Les-Flots with a single paddle. Unlike surfboarding, stand-up paddle boarding, otherwise known as SUP does not require hours of learning how to fall off the board; instead, the trickiest part of SUP would be learning how to keep your balance. A one-hour introductory lesson will get you up and paddling with confidence, and after mastering the basics, you can proceed with playing games in groups on the water. Anyone over the age of eight can participate and the only other requirement is to know how to swim. 


> #### Take a class in paddle boarding 
>
> [Book Now](https://www.adrenaline-hunter.com/en-GB/activity/france/montpellier/stand-up-paddle/initiation-stand-up-paddle-a-palavas-les-flots/6833?_cid=229)
>
> **Duration**: 1 hour
>
> **Price**: 17 USD
